reviews.review_msg: She is a good prof. and encourages people to voice out their thoughts which adds an extra dimension to the lecture. Being said that one must read the weekly reading material to understand the lectures and take notes of the important concepts. It's a lecture heavy course and she doesn't share her ppts. Interesting class and relatively easy!

Pretty good prof. Has Interesting topics in class like world poverty, facial discrimination in the workplace, technology taking over etc... She does promote her vegan feminist views a lot, however, in a fair and intelligent manner. Exams were fair and grading on papers were fair too. Overall a solid prof
BEST CLASS AND PROF EVER!!! SO INSPIRATIONAL!!!! I LOVE YOU MICHAELA!!!!!

Her exams are heavily based on lecture notes. You need the textbook for her papers and to memorize quotes for exams. Her exams are fair; she provides a review guide which specifies concepts you should study. You will have to memorize a lot of information for her exams.
I love her lectures. One of the best profs I've had at SFU. Extremely engaging and intelligent. Course really opens your eyes up. Have to attend lectures. Highly recommend.

Lecture slides arent posted. But she tells you what you need to know in class, and gives amazing guidelines for her mid terms which allow you to pretty much learn all concepts. She is always willing to explain concepts or readings if you talk to her or even go to her office hours. Very compassionate person as well.

Very respectful, but the class can get heated. Often goes off on long tangents. Doesn't post slides so you need to attend class or get them elsewhere. Subjective marking and a lot of material to know. This isn't supposed to be a difficult course. My friends who had different profs were shocked at how hard we had it.

Michaela was an engaging lecturer but it seemed like she often used her lectures as a soapbox to promote veganism. She never showed up for her office hours. Both papers were graded subjectively by TA. Overall a decent class with decent amount of work (2 papers, midterm, final). Attend lectures for useful notes as she doesn't post them.
Michaela was a great prof overall and really encourages participation in lectures! She is quite open minded and allows students to disagree on reasonable matters.

Michaela was alright. She was very interested in what she was teaching, however she was also very opinionated and came off offensive to many people as a result. Her class had two papers, one MT and a final. Not too heavy of a workload. Papers and tests were not hard if you took time to review the material, but this also meant high averages.
Great prof and great class. Read the textbook and attend class for in class examples. Not a hard class but does require reading every week. Also get a good group for term project.
Really nice guy, 4 written reflections and a group project and essay. Midterm was easy if you go over his slides. Overall a super manageable course and high averages.
Honestly, not as bad as people make him out to be on ratemyprof. He's boring yes, but you get marked on a few things. Barely paid attention and managed to get a B-.
Barely went to class but kept up with the readings cause of the weekly assignments. Just know the important theories of each chapter final will emphasize the four theories of bus ethics during exams.

The lectures were fine, a little boring. A lot of the criteria and the grading was unclear, in my opinion. The biggest issue I had with the class was I made it a point to attend and participate in EVERY lecture, and somehow still only received 84 for the participation portion, which was still above the average, so I don't how I could've gotten 100.
His class is so damn boring that his lectures are like lullaby. He does not provide clear feedbacks with his reflections. He does not provide proper criteria for ethics individual assignment.
class is zzzzZZzzzzz, grading kind of weird, doesnt really provide feedback or context, no clear criteria. nice guy though.

Prepare for the deadly written reflections. Most of the reflection's required readings were 20 pages long and you have to read them in order to write the WR. TA will mark the WR and you are most likely going to get the same mark over the semester (low or high demand on you). Definitely avoid if you are not a patient reader or have a heavy schedule.

I really enjoyed taking BUS303 with Hooley! Requires some work (reflections, exams, participation, Ethics Project) but definitely manageable. Exams are all based on his slides, and he is a very fair and generous marker. If you're willing to learn the material, you will do very well in his class. Taking this course with Dan makes it worthwhile.

This class wasn't that hard but time consuming. The ethics project is fine if you get good group members but he decides the group by last name..... -__- very annoying. anyway his lectures are alright but kind boring at times.
Dan is great. Take him and you wont regret.

Dan was great, kept material interesting and relevant. He tests only on PPT slides so the textbooks and reading are unnecessary. Papers are graded fairly easy, and tests aren't difficult if you understand and memorize course content. Pay attention in lectures and make notes on PPT's and you'll be good. As good a choice as Shafik.
AVOID! I wish I took this class with Shafik instead of DAN. He could get through the lecture material in 1.5 hours but instead takes 3. VAGUE essay prompts. V boring.
One of the most boring and impractical business courses available at SFU. Avoid Dan, take it with Shafik instead, I didn't but I wish I did.

BUS303 is a full 3 hours of Hooley talking and the worst part is that he's a boring speaker. Going to lecture is really informative, but it's super boring. His slides are constructed really poorly and really text heavy.

Daniel is one of my favourite instructors at SFU. He is really helpful and provides good feedback on assignments. So if you cannot take 303 from Shafik don't worry since Daniel is as good as Shafik IMO. His lectures are chill but you have to participate in class discussions. His exams and assignments are fair. I definitely recommend him!
